radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Nephrocalcinosis was detected at 3 months of age. At 9 months, two hyperechogenic images were observed in the left lower renal pole, and a 6 mm stone in the right ureter was noted. Ultrasound scans at 12 and 20 months showed improvement in nephrocalcinosis and persistence of the two left kidney stones, unchanged from the previous examination.
